senses.de: To plan or want to do something
senses.ex: I intend to finish my homework before hanging out with friends.

Tips.title: Future Actions
Tips.description: Use 'intend' to express what you are planning to do in the near or distant future.
Tips.example: She intends to study abroad next year.

Tips.title: Personal Desire
Tips.description: 'Intend' often conveys a strong personal commitment or determination to do something.
Tips.example: He intends to win the competition, no matter what.

Tips.title: Prepositions Matter
Tips.description: Pay attention to prepositions after 'intend': 'to' for actions, 'for' for purposes or recipients.
Tips.example: They intend to go camping. / He intended the gift for you.

senses.ex: The guidebook intends the term 'difficult' to mean physically challenging.

Tips.title: Conveying Meaning
Tips.description: Use 'intend' when you want to clarify what a word or expression is meant to communicate.
Tips.example: She used 'thrive' and intended it to convey growth and success.

Tips.title: Cultural Context
Tips.description: 'Intend' can indicate that words have specific meanings in cultural or situational contexts.
Tips.example: In our culture, 'family' intends a broader network than just parents and children.

Tips.title: Literal vs. Figurative
Tips.description: Differentiate whether 'intend' is used for literal meaning or figurative expression.
Tips.example: He said 'lionhearted' and intended it figuratively to mean brave.

Aim.wordDefinition:
Aim refers to a specific goal or objective that someone is trying to achieve.

It can also refer to a direction or target that someone is trying to hit. An example of its use would be someone saying that they aim to finish their homework before dinner.

Intend refers to a planned course of action or a purpose that someone has in mind. It typically implies a greater level of intention and thoughtfulness than 'aim.' An example of its use would be someone saying that they intend to study for three hours every day this week in order to do well on their upcoming exam.

Aim refers to a specific goal or target, while intend refers to a planned course of action or purpose. Both words are applicable in many situations, but aim is more commonly used to describe a specific action, while intend is more commonly used to describe an overarching plan or purpose.

Aspire.wordDefinition:
Aspire means to have a strong desire or goal to achieve something. It is applicable when someone has a dream or ambition that they are working towards, but it may not be a concrete plan.

In simpler terms, aspire refers to a dream or wish for something, while intend refers to a concrete plan or goal.

Design.wordDefinition:
Design refers to creating a plan or blueprint for something, whereas intend refers to having a purpose or goal in mind for something.

- An architect might design a building by creating detailed plans and blueprints for its construction.

Both words are applicable in a variety of contexts, but design generally refers to the act of creating something, while intend refers to the aim or purpose behind that creation.

Intention.wordDefinition:
Intention refers to a person's aim or purpose. It describes what someone wants to do, but it does not necessarily imply that they will act on it.

For example, "My intention is to get good grades this semester."

Intend describes an action someone plans to take, while intention describes a person's desired outcome or goal.

Mean.wordDefinition:
Intend means to have a plan or a purpose, as in "I intend to study hard for my exams." It relates to what someone wants to achieve or do.

Mean means to express or convey a particular idea or message, as in "What does this sentence mean?" It relates to the understanding and interpretation of what someone has said or written.

Both words are applicable for expressing thoughts and intentions, but intend is used when talking about plans and mean is used when talking about explanations.

Plan.wordDefinition:
Plan refers to arranging or preparing a course of action for achieving a goal. For example, "I plan to study for two hours every day to prepare for my exams".

Intend is about your state of mind or what you want to achieve, while plan is about taking practical steps to achieve your goal.

Purpose.wordDefinition:
Intend means to have a plan or goal in mind. Purpose means the reason why you want to do something. Intend is applicable when you are talking about what you plan to do or what you want to achieve.

Purpose is applicable when you are talking about the reason behind your actions or decisions. In simpler terms, intend is about the plan while purpose is about the reason for the plan.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
Resolve means to make a firm decision or determination to do something. If you resolve to quit smoking, it means you have made a firm decision to stop smoking.

Resolve is applicable when referring to a decision you have made or a determination to do something.

Intend refers to having a plan or goal in mind, while resolve refers to making a firm decision or determination to do something.

quotes.Text: To be always intending to make a new and better life but never to find time to set about it is as to put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day to the next until you're dead.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Og Mandino

quotes.Text: Property is intended to serve life, and no matter how much we surround it with rights and respect, it has no personal being. It is part of the earth man walks on. It is not man.
quotes.Title: American Leader
quotes.Name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.Text: I don't expect to live forever, but I do intend to hang on as long as possible.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Isaac Asimov

quotes.Text: I've always been into self-dramatization. I intend to live forever.
quotes.Title: Canadian Singer
quotes.Name: Leonard Cohen

quotes.Text: It is kindness to immediately refuse what you intend to deny.
quotes.Title: Roman Writer
quotes.Name: Publilius Syrus

quotes.Text: Travel is a passion. I intend seeing the world.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Anushka Shetty

quotes.Text: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright

quotes.Text: I intend to live forever, or die trying.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Groucho Marx

quotes.Text: I intend to live life, not just exist.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: George Takei

quotes.Text: I intend to act forever if I can.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Reid Scott
